title: Harley Quinn In Batman Adventures
description:
Every Harley Quinn appearance in Batman Adventures (vol 1 and vol 2)


Mad Love: 
A one-shot comic book written by Paul Dini (writer on Batman: The Animated Series and Batman Beyond) and Bruce Timm (executive producer on The New Batman/Superman Adventures and the co-creator of Batman: The Animated Series). The story revolves around the Joker's sidekick Harley Quinn, who was once psychiatrist Dr. Harleen Quinzel. She falls in love with the Joker after treating him inside Arkham Asylum, where he tells her that he was abused as a child by his alcoholic father. She develops an obsession with him, and turns to crime just to win his love.

Batman Adventures Annual Vol 1: 
Appears in "24 Hours", "Going Straight Part 2 (as an illusion only) and "Laughter After Midnight".

Batgirl - Day One: 
This issue contains the first ever comic book appearance of Harley Quinn!

Twelve Days Of Madness: 
Batman investigates why certain Gotham politicians running for council are going insane in order of descending weight. And what does this have to do with the Joker's Arkham Asylum production of 'The Twelve Days of Christmas' supervised by a new doctor?

No Asylum: 
The Penguin, who is now mayor, outlaws vigilantes and the League of Assassins (here called Society of Shadows) attacks Arkham and its residence with orders to kill Batman's Rogues gallery.

Deathtrap A Go-Go!:
